articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Blasts UNSC's Press Statement Critical of Its Launch of Short-range Missiles
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Blasts UNSC's Press Statement Critical of Its Launch of Short-range Missiles
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The UN Security Council at its informal consultative meeting held on July 17 staged a farce of publishing a press statement terming the DPRK's launch of even short-range missiles a "violation of its resolutions." 
					 The Foreign Ministry of the DPRK in a statement on Saturday said all the military measures taken by the Korean People's Army including tactical rocket firing are an exercise of the right to self-defence to protect the sovereignty of the country and the security of the nation from the U.S. nuclear threats and moves for aggression from A to Z.
					
					 This year the DPRK made a series of positive peace proposals ranging from the crucial proposal of its National Defence Commission and its special proposal to the statement of its government and has taken practical measures pursuant to them, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The U.S., however, staged Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises in succession together with the south Korean puppet forces and kicked off the largest-ever combined aerial drill in the wake of the large-scale joint landing exercises since 1993.
					
					 The UNSC persistently overlooked the U.S. madcap war maneuvers for aggression and nuclear threat and took issue with the inevitable option taken by the DPRK to cope with them and censured it. This is absolutely intolerable. 
					
					 If the UNSC is to perform its mission for ensuring global peace and security, it should call into question the offensive, threatening and provocative joint military exercises of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 How the UNSC approaches the said exercises will be a yardstick to assess its impartiality and judge whether it can contribute to global peace and security both in name and in reality or not.
					
					 Now that the UNSC serves the purpose of the U.S. hostile moves against the DPRK, bereft of its impartiality, the DPRK is left with no option but to bolster up its muscle to protect itself by its own efforts.
					
					 No matter how fair-minded and just one may be, one is bound to fall victim to big powers if one is weak, and it is possible to protect  genuine peace only when one builds its muscle strong enough to deter any force from provoking one. This is the lesson and truth taught by history.
					
					 The further the U.S. escalates its nuclear threat and blackmail, the greater efforts the DPRK will channel into bolstering up its nuclear deterrence for self-defence. As long as the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces persist in their joint military exercises for aggression, the DPRK's counter-actions will be put on an annual and regular basis.
					
					 Any conflict which may take place in the course of the Korean People's Army's tactical rocket firing and other intensified retaliatory drills to cope with the U.S ceaseless war maneuvers in south Korea and its vicinity may spill over to a war.
					
					 In case an unpredictable situation is created on the Korean peninsula, the U.S. and the UNSC which instigated and patronized it will be wholly responsible for the development as it compelled the DPRK to take such inevitable option.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Scuttling North-South Working-level Talks
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Scuttling North-South Working-level Talks
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The head of the north side's delegation to the north-south working-level talks for discussing the participation of the DPRK's players group and cheerleading squad in the 17th Asian Games issued a statement on Saturday in connection with the fact that the talks which opened at Panmunjom on July 17 broke down due to the base moves of the south Korean authorities.   The statement accused the south side of resorting to a shameless smear campaign by falsifying facts.
					 The head of the delegation expressed indignation at the south Korean authorities who are misleading public opinion in a bid to evade the blame for bringing the talks to a rupture and once again made a detailed account of the whole course of the talks.
					
					 According to him, the morning talks took place in a very amicable atmosphere due to the cooperative attitude of both sides.
					
					 The north side tried to enter the venue of the talks as they were scheduled to resume at 2:00 p.m. but the south side asked it to wait for a moment as it did not receive an instruction from Seoul.
					
					 Consequently, the afternoon talks resumed 2 hours and 15 minutes later. Delegates to the south side looked so flushed that they were beyond imagination. No sooner had they sat down, without saying sorry for making their counterpart wait for such a long time, than all of them including the chief delegate vied with each other to take issue with the proposal of the north side for no reason, talking about "international practice" and "rules of games".
					
					 Overturning what they had said in the morning, the south side took issue with all contents of the proposal and behaved in a provocative manner.
					
					 The south side hurled unbearable mud at the north side, talking about paying one's own expenses, after raising the issue of expenses which the north side has never mentioned.
					
					 The north side called the south side to account for its wrong attitude and urged it to sincerely approach the discussion of the issue while explaining again the proposal of the north side.
					
					 But the south side turned the venue of the talks into a scene of argument as its members vied with each other to shout hoarse. No one could recognize who was the chief delegate and delegate, an attempt to let Chongwadae hear what was going on there.
					
					 Finding it hard to continue the talks, the north side strongly denounced the south side for its behavior to scuttle them and repeatedly and sternly warned of its reckless behavior. But the delegates of the south side became more provocative, bereft of any etiquette.
					
					 In the long run, the afternoon talks were suspended in less than half an hour, without taking up the issue. The talks thus broke down.
					
					 The head of the north side's delegation went on:
					
					 All what happened makes it clear that after the morning talks the delegates of the south side received an instruction from Chongwadae that they should stick to their position, not responding to the proposal of the north.
					
					 The working-level talks fully revealed that "confidence" and the like touted by the south Korean authorities are nothing but sheer lies and they have no iota of idea of having dialogue and improving the relations.
					
					 The whole course of the talks proved that the south Korean authorities are not pleased with the participation of the DPRK's players group and cheerleading squad in the Asian Games and are working hard to prevent the DPRK from taking part in the games by insulting it and getting on  the nerves of it at any cost.
					
					 The south side talked about "international practice" and the like but it is none other than the south Korean authorities who violated the international practice and rules.
					
					 Are there international practice and rules of games restricting the scope of players group and cheerleading squad. Do they bar any country's players from holding their national flags as they please and define the size of national flags?
					
					 If international practice is followed, it is enough for the DPRK to notify the south side of the intention of its players group to participate in the games as other countries do and there is no need for the north and the south to sit together.
					
					 The south side is trying to shift the blame for the scuttled talks onto the DPRK while insulting it after raising the issue of expenses which it has never mentioned. This fully revealed the disposition of a mean dealer who knows only money and counts everything with money and vulgarity of depraved guys and traitors who count the noble spirit of national concord and even the inviolable sports and cultural activities with the help of an abacus.
					
					 The south Korean authorities can never evade the blame for deliberately bringing the talks to a breakdown. They should discard narrow-minded prejudice toward fellow countrymen and the old way of thinking and conception in the era of confrontation and behave in line with the people's mindset, the aspiration of the nation and the trend of the times, though belatedly.
					
					 Whether the DPRK's players group and cheerleading squad will take part in the 17th Asian Games in the future or not entirely depends on the attitude of the south Korean authorities as already declared by it.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Malaysian PM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Malaysian PM
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Saturday sent a message of sympathy to Datuk Seri Mohamad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak, prime minister of Malaysia, as regards the recent sudden crash of a Malaysian airliner which claimed the lives of all the passengers and the crew on board.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the Malaysian government and people and the bereaved families of the victims.

articles.title: Congratulations to British Foreign Secretary
articles.content:
Congratulations to British Foreign Secretary
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Philip Hammond upon his appointment as foreign secretary of Britain.
					 The message expressed expectation and belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow strong in the mutual interests, wishing him success in his new job.

articles.title: Swiss Party Delegation Here
articles.content:
Swiss Party Delegation Here
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Communist Party of Italian-Speaking Region in Switzerland led by Lucchini Alessandro, deputy secretary for political affairs, arrived here Saturday.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Visit Hyangha Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Visit Hyangha Revolutionary Site
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) visited the Hyangha Revolutionary Site on July 18 on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. The site is associated with the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in winning the war. 
					 They placed a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues of the President and leader Kim Jong Il in Kanggye City and paid tribute to them and then held a meeting before leaving for the site.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said that through their visit to the revolutionary site the service personnel should deeply grasp the undying revolutionary feats of the peerless great men and prepare themselves to be those strong in idea and faith.
					
					 After the meeting the service personnel visited the revolutionary museum in Jagang Province and marched toward the revolutionary site.
					
					 There are at the site which is located in Janggang County, Jagang Province the relics in which the President organized the Third Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea during the war and led the whole party and army and all the people to win the war.
					
					 There are also houses where he stayed, took meals and talked to people, the place where the plenary meeting was held, a spring site and other relics.
					
					 Looking round several places of the site, the service personnel grasped again the personality of the President as a great man and his noble traits.
					
					 Meanwhile, service personnel visited the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Korean People's Army in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Corundum Materials to Be Widely Used in DPRK
articles.content:
Corundum Materials to Be Widely Used in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Solar Heater Company of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has attained big successes in research into corundum, deposited in some parts of the country.
					 In this regard, Kim Thae Song, a section chief of the company, told KCNA:
					
					 My company succeeded in making fireproof bricks, grindstone and bearing by use of natural corundum.
					
					 Those made with corundum materials were found to be superior to the existing ones in all technical indices.
					
					 In particular, corundum grindstone is seven times longer in serviceable life than cyanite grindstone.

articles.title: Rocket Development and Launches Are Independent Right of Sovereign State: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Rocket Development and Launches Are Independent Right of Sovereign State: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. submitted a document calling for discussing the matter of the DPRK's rocket firing to the UN Security Council. The south Korean authorities are also dancing to the tune of the U.S.
					 Minju Joson Saturday in a commentary terms this a deliberate action to pull up the DPRK and a politically-motivated undisguised provocation to it.
					
					 It is a legitimate independent right of a sovereign state to develop and fire rockets, it notes, and continues:
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its scenario to invade the DPRK even at present and it is the arch criminal threatening the peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It is a very just measure for self-defense for the Korean People's Army to stage routine rocket-firing drills to cope with the U.S. constant threat of aggression. 
					
					 It is the firm will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to deal decisive blows at aggressor forces coming in attack on it whether they are nuclear carriers or other type weapons.
					
					 Peace on the Korean peninsula is preserved thanks to the tremendous military muscle of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. absurd act of taking issue with the KPA's routine rocket firing drills can cut no ice with anyone as the former is standing in the way of improving the inter-Korean ties by screwing up the situation on the peninsula through its dangerous war drills for the invasion of the north.
					
					 The DPRK will intensify the drive for implementing the line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force true to the Songun politics, the validity of which has been proven in practice.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The hostile policy of the Obama administration towards the DPRK is like a stone-throwing by a blind one. Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a commentary. 
					 As the hostile policy serves as a lever for carrying out the U.S. pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy, its absurdity is being brought to light day by day, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has massively stockpiled weaponry in its arsenals in and around the Korean peninsula to invade the DPRK under the pretext of its "nuclear issue" and contain big powers in its vicinity. 
					
					 The U.S. is not rolling back its hostile policy towards the DPRK though it is labeled a backstage manipulator of the crises in Syria and Ukraine and the failure of its Iraqi and Afghan policies is becoming a reality. 
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK and its scenario for dominating the whole of the Korean peninsula are no more than the ambition of the old man at the deathbed. 
					
					 The war maneuvers now under way in the East and South seas of Korea are nothing but the desperate military moves of the U.S. to get ride of the embarrassing position where it is compelled to leave the host's seat in a banquet. 
					
					 The U.S. which boasted of being the world's "only superpower" is now in an absolutely abnormal condition. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to totally defuse the confrontation with the DPRK, a politico-ideological power. The U.S. should not overlook the views of news analysts that it is the only and wise strategic option to be taken by the U.S. and a measure required by the international situation surrounding the peninsula. 
					
					 It is the remedy suited to the present position of the U.S. to drop its hostile policy towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Papers Call for Boosting DPRK-Russia Friendly and Cooperative Relations
articles.content:
Papers Call for Boosting DPRK-Russia Friendly and Cooperative Relations
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A solid foundation has been provided to comprehensively develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Russia thanks to the DPRK-Russia summit and the adoption of the DPRK-Russia joint declaration in Pyongyang in July, Juche 89 (2000), say papers Saturday in articles.
					 It is the common desire and will of the peoples of the two countries to boost the traditional DPRK-Russia relations of friendship and cooperation, Rodong Sinmun says, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK-Russia joint declaration is a historic milestone to newly develop the traditional DPRK-Russia relations of friendship and cooperation and the driving force for the sound development of the international relations and global peace.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have been developed on a high stage since the adoption of the DPRK-Russia joint declaration.
					
					 The DPRK-Russia relations have been steadily developed on the principle of friendship, cooperation and good-neighborliness under the care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The Korean people will as ever make efforts to boost the DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations in the spirit of the DPRK-Russia joint declaration.
					
					 Minju Joson notes that the DPRK-Russia friendly relations will steadily develop thanks to the aspiration, requirement and efforts of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Participants in Rallies, Demos Suppressed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Participants in Rallies, Demos Suppressed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on July 15 said the authorities are further intensifying than ever before  the suppression of the participants in rallies and demos.
					 According to it, the number of legal actions taken against the participants in rallies and demos so far increased by 67.2 percent as against last year; that of detainees swelled to nearly 216.7 percent and that of those left without physical detention by 74.1 percent. 355 participants in memorial services for the victims of the ferry Sewol disaster were subject to those legal actions. 
					
					 The paper expressed concern over the threat made by the police authorities to continue walking off participants in rallies and demos and severely punish their sponsors.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Opening Rice Market
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Opening Rice Market
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Members of peasants organizations of south Korea including the Federation of Peasants Associations, the Federation of Women Peasants Associations and the Catholic Peasants Association held a press conference in Seoul on July 18 in protest against the authorities' moves to open rice market.
					 At the press conference speakers accused the present chief executive of trying to sell off the food sovereignty of this land through the opening of rice market.
					
					 The present regime is a dictatorial one which declared a fight against the peasants, defying their strong demand, they said, declaring they would stage a dynamic action to defend the food sovereignty.
					
					 Enraged to hear the news that the regime made a decision to totally open the rice market of south Korea, the peasants staged a fierce demonstration to storm the "government" building.
					
					 They branded the "government's" decision as an act of treachery.
					
					 The opening of the rice market means bringing profits to the plutocrats at the sacrifice of the peasantry, they charged.
					
					 They declared they would wage positive actions in solidarity with people of various circles against the avarice of the present regime and plutocrats.

articles.title: Helicopter Crash in S. Korea
articles.content:
Helicopter Crash in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A helicopter under the fire headquarters of south Korean Kangwon Province crashed in Kwangju on July 17, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The accident left all five persons aboard the helicopter dead, causing fire in the place where the helicopter crashed.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Accuse S. Korean Authorities of Sidestepping Institution of Special Law
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Accuse S. Korean Authorities of Sidestepping Institution of Special Law
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. released a statement on July 15 accusing the south Korean ruling quarters of sidestepping the issue of instituting a special law on probing the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster proposed by the families of its victims.
					 The statement recalled that the bill signed by millions of people is in danger of miscarriage due to the opposition of the "Saenuri Party."
					
					 It expressed disillusionment with the double-dealing attitude of the chief executive and the lawmakers from the "Saenuri Party" dragging on the probe into the truth about the disaster and feigning ignorance of it though they promised to make efforts during the June 4 local elections. 
					
					 The statement urged the "Saenuri Party" not to turn its face away from the proposal made by the people any longer, declaring that the special law should be instituted to have the grudge of the dead students settled and the pain of the bereaved families alleviated.

articles.title: Statement of DPRK Government Supported by Bolivian Organization
articles.content:
Statement of DPRK Government Supported by Bolivian Organization
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Bolivia-Korea Friendship Association issued a statement on July 8 in support of the statement of the DPRK government.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Bolivian people who experienced the imperialists' moves for the national estrangement know well about the harmfulness of the imperialists and their followers' moves to perpetuate the division of Korea and pain the Korean nation is suffering.
					
					 The Korean nation should be certainly reunified as it is the homogeneous nation.
					
					 The DPRK has already made the most just and reasonable proposals for reunification including the proposal of founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and made sincere efforts to realize them.
					
					 We fully support the statement issued by the DPRK government to improve the north-south relations and usher in a turning phase of independent reunification.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Myanmar
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Myanmar
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The acting secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar made public a statement on July 8, the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Paying highest tribute to Kim Il Sung, the statement said:
					
					 We look back with deep reverence on the undying exploits the President performed by liberating the country, beating back the invasion by the U.S. imperialists, building powerful socialism and devoting himself to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness and the sacred cause of global peace and stability.
					
					 Under the wise guidance of the President and HE Kim Jong Il the DPRK turned into an invincible power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence which achieved the single-minded unity of the leader, party and masses.
					
					 Their noble cause is being successfully carried forward by HE Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the party and state of the DPRK.
					
					 Under his leadership the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people have made eye-opening achievements in building an economic power and improving the people's living standard while firmly defending socialism from the hostile forces' vicious moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 We are convinced that the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il will be successfully accomplished under the guidance of Kim Jong Un. We extend once again support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated by Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Political parties, ministries, organizations and institutions of Cuba and Nicaragua and foreign diplomatic missions in Havana sent floral baskets and bouquets to the DPRK embassy in Havana on July 8, the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Laid before the full-length painting depicting Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together were floral baskets and bouquets sent by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces, Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, Prensa Latina News Agency, a research institute and a chamber of commerce of Cuba and the Sandinist National Liberation Front of Nicaragua. 
					
					 Also placed before it were floral baskets and bouquets in the name of the embassies of Laos, Syria, Venezuela, Equatorial Guinea, Congo, Nigeria and Nicaragua and the military attaches corps in Havana.
					
					 Meanwhile, the president of the "C.I.S. Estero" Group of Italy visited the DPRK embassy in Rome on July 9 to lay a bouquet before the full-length painting depicting Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Syrian Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Syrian Media
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Syrian media carried special write-ups titled "On the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of HE President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people" from July 5 to 13.
					 SANA said that the President was a person of noble character possessed of benevolent virtues and a great statesman who performed the outstanding military feats with his Juche-oriented military idea, strategies and tactics.
					
					 The newspaper Al Thawrah referred to his energetic ideological, theoretical activities and external activities, saying that he is always alive amid the profound reverence of all people for him.
					
					 Newspapers Al Baath and Al Nour lauded him as the outstanding strategist and iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation.
					
					 Another newspaper said that he successfully realized the cause of building the party, army and state and made immortal contributions to the national reunification and the cause of global independence.
					
					 The Syria TV Channel aired the undying feats performed by Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence, with photos documenting their revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Central Radio made a special report praising the President who made great contributions to the country's prosperity, people's happiness and the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Different Countries
Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries from July 4 to 8 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. They included meetings, seminars, remembrance meetings, round-table talks, reading sessions, book and photo exhibitions and film shows in Cambodia, Myanmar, Slovakia, Germany, Egypt and Equatorial Guinea.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation".
					
					 The general director for administrative affairs of the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia praised Kim Il Sung for leading the two revolutionary wars to victory after embarking upon the road of revolution in his teens and turning the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence and making a great contribution to developing the friendly relations between the two parties and countries.
					
					 The acting secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar said that the distinguished feats performed by Kim Il Sung for the prosperity of the country and its  people's happiness and the cause of global independence will always be remembered by the Korean people and progressive mankind.
					
					 The chairman of the Slovakia-Korea Friendship Association stressed that there was no such man as Kim Il Sung in the world.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany noted that thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's firm independent stand socialism in the DPRK could win victories, remaining unfazed even after the collapse of socialism in the  East European countries.

articles.title: Desarrollo y lanzamiento de cohete son derechos de estado soberano, insiste Minju Joson
articles.content:
Desarrollo y lanzamiento de cohete son derechos de estado soberano, insiste Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun trascendidos, recientemente Estados Unidos envio un documento al Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU en demanda de discusion del asunto de lanzamiento de cohete de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y las autoridades del Sur de Corea tambien actuan al son que le toca este imperio.
					En un comentario individual divulgado este sabado, el periodico Minju Joson critica que  esto es un desafio intencional y una abierta provocacion politica contra la RPDC.
					
					Desarrollar y lanzar cohete son justos derechos independientes de un Estado soberano, subraya el comentario y continua:
					
					Es invariable la ambicion de EE.UU. de agredir la RPDC. El imperio es el provocador y fautor que amenaza la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El ejercito de la RPDC realiza normalmente el entrenamiento de lanzamiento de cohete para hacer frente a la permanente amenaza de agresion de EE.UU., lo que es una medida autodefensiva tan justa.
					
					Rechazar tajantemente a la banda agresora es inconmovible voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC.
					
					La paz de la Peninsula Coreana es garantizada por el fidedigno poderio militar de la RPDC.
					
					EE.UU. con sus peligrosos ejercicios de guerra de agresion a la RPDC, exacerba la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana e impide la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas.  A pesar de esto, cuestiona absurdamente los ejercicios normales de lanzamiento de cohete del ejercito de Corea, lo que no convencera a nadie.
					
					En acato a la politica del Songun cuya justeza fue comprobada en la realidad, la RPDC se entregara a materializar la linea del desarrollo paralelo de la construccion economica y la de las fuerzas armadas nucleares.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda a EE.UU. retirar la politica hostil a RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda a EE.UU. retirar la politica hostil a RPDC
Pyongyang, 19 de julio (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual divulgado este sabado, el diario Rodong Sinmun compara la politica hostil de la administracion Obama sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con el acto imprudente de quien hace punetazos a ciegas. 
					En estos momentos en que la politica hostil se hizo un instrumento para el cumplimiento de la estrategia de EE.UU. de dar importancia a la region de Asia-Pacifico, se revela cada dia mas el caracter absurdo de ella, adelanta el comentarista y continua: 
					
					Con el fin de agredir a la RPDC bajo el pretexto del "problema nuclear" y controlar a las potencias perifericas, EE.UU. introduce en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno enormes armamentos mortiferos. 
					
					El imperio no renuncia la politica hostil a la RPDC aunque se gano la mala fama de controlador trasero de las crisis de Siria y Ucrania y se hace evidente el fracaso de su politica sobre Iraq y Afganistan. 
					
					La politica hostil a la RPDC, o sea, la ambicion de dominar toda la Peninsula Coreana no pasa de ser la ambicion irrealizable de un anciano en agonia. 
					
					Los ejercicios belicos, que tienen lugar en los Mares Este y Sur de Corea, son el ultimo recurso de EE.UU. empantanado en crisis.
					
					Los analistas de la situacion opinan que renunciar totalmente el enfrentamiento con la RPDC reconocida como potencia ideo-politica es el unico y sensato remedio estrategico para EE.UU. y la medida demandada por la situacion internacional en torno a la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Las autoridades norteamericanas deben escuchar ese consejo. 
					
					La cancelacion de la politica hostil a la RPDC es la receta conveniente a EE.UU.
